extendedIngredients.name: pine nuts
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons pine nuts, finely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: wonton wrappers
extendedIngredients.original: 1 12-ounce package gyoza wrappers or wonton wrappers

title: Cabbage, Watercress and Pine Nut Dumplings
summary: Cabbage, Watercress and Pine Nut Dumplings might be just the hor d'oeuvre you are searching for. One serving contains 45 calories, 3g of protein, and 1g of fat. This recipe serves 36. For 28 cents per serving, this recipe covers 3% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour. If you have watercress, kosher salt, pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 18%. This score is not so amazing. Similar recipes are Agnolotti with Roasted Broccoli and Spinach in a Buttered Pine Nut Sauce, Watercress-and-Tofu Dumplings, and Creamy Peppadew pasta with watercress and pine nuts.
instructions: On a work surface, combine the chopped watercress, cabbage, scallions, garlic and pine nuts and finely chop them all together. Transfer the mixture to a bowl and season with the salt and white pepper. Knead the mixture slightly to wilt the greens.                                              Spread 6 gyoza wrappers on a work surface and brush the edges with water. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the filling into the center of each wrapper and fold in half; press the edges firmly to seal, pressing out any air pockets. Transfer the dumplings to a cornstarch-dusted baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.                                              In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the dumplings until tender and translucent, about 3 minutes. Alternatively, steam the dumplings on a rack set on a pan over boiling water. Serve the dumplings hot with soy sauce.

steps.step: On a work surface, combine the chopped watercress, cabbage, scallions, garlic and pine nuts and finely chop them all together.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and season with the salt and white pepper. Knead the mixture slightly to wilt the greens.

Spread 6 gyoza wrappers on a work surface and brush the edges with water. Spoon 2 teaspoons of the filling into the center of each wrapper and fold in half; press the edges firmly to seal, pressing out any air pockets.
Transfer the dumplings to a cornstarch-dusted baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.
In a pot of boiling salted water, cook the dumplings until tender and translucent, about 3 minutes. Alternatively, steam the dumplings on a rack set on a pan over boiling water.
Serve the dumplings hot with soy sauce.
